intro: Cola sulcata, commonly known as the African kola nut tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces hard, elongated fruits that contain the aromatic kola nuts used in traditional ceremonies and beverages. Cola sulcata thrives in humid, warm climates with well-drained soil and is often found in secondary forests and cultivated areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts.
